issue.title: C++: separate test codes
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-84](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-84). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently test codes reside with normal codes together. Not sure if it's a good practice in C++, but guess it would be much clean to separate the test codes out into a `test` folder.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-84?focusedCommentId=15214356) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I don't agree with this. This is pretty standard practice in many projects following the Google C++ style. See Kudu and Impala, for example. https://github.com/apache/incubator-kudu/tree/master/src/kudu

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-84?focusedCommentId=15215134) by Kai Zheng (drankye):*
Thanks for clarifying this. It sounds good. Let me close this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-84?focusedCommentId=17586053) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
